description:
Which of the DnD classes is best? Each can fill varied roles in an adventuring party, and they bring different skills, complexity levels, and play styles to the table. However, while Wizards of the Coast has kept the power levels between classes pretty well balanced, there are some standout winners and losers. Using our years of RPG experience, we’ve ranked all the Dungeons and Dragons classes.

If you already know which class you want to play, here are a few extra guides to help you roll up a character. We can tell you everything you need to know about DnD races, as well as the
title: All DnD classes ranked from worst to best

description:
A job listing on the official Hasbro recruitment website for a ‘product architect’ for Dungeons and Dragons reveals that “co-created releases featuring external IP” are a priority for the firm. Though this is just one part of a senior role with lots of responsibilities, it’s a significant enough focus that it appears in the very first bullet point.

Continue reading Wizards wants to make more DnD products using outside IP
MORE FROM WARGAMER: DnD 2024 Player's Handbook review,
title: Wizards wants to make more DnD products using outside IP

description:
If you want to take your Dungeons and Dragons game somewhere truly horrifying, look no further than Plane Shift: Duskmourn, a fan-made supplement for players and dungeon masters alike. Available for free online, it has everything you need to create characters or run adventures in Duskmourn, a dimension-spanning haunted house, the setting for the latest Magic the Gathering set.

Continue reading DnD fan turns MTG’s horror plane Duskmourn into a homebrew sourcebook
MORE FROM WARGAMER:
title: DnD fan turns MTG’s horror plane Duskmourn into a homebrew sourcebook

description:
On Saturday, Games Workshop capped off its Warhammer Day preview screen with a tantalizing glimpse of the logo for the Emperor’s Children, Chaos Space Marines pledged to the dark prince Slaanesh, with the promise ‘Coming 2025’. This almost certainly indicates a new Warhammer 40k Emperor’s Children miniature range, with interesting implications for the game and the setting.

Continue reading Warhammer 40k’s Emperor’s Children army is back - here’s what that means
MORE FROM W
title: Warhammer 40k’s Emperor’s Children army is back - here’s what that means

description:
Almost 20 years after it appeared in the Yugioh GX anime, a real version of the spell card Double Fusion has been made for the OCG. The new card is a promo on the December special issue of the Japanese manga magazine V Jump.

Continue reading 20-year old Yugioh card from the anime is finally real (and it kinda sucks)
MORE FROM WARGAMER: Yugioh banlist,
title: 20-year old Yugioh card from the anime is finally real (and it kinda sucks)

description:
Lots of Magic: The Gathering cards that are currently banned in the Commander format are spiking in price. Since September 30, 2024 some of the most well-known banned cards in EDH have seen their prices rise by at least 100%.

Continue reading Loads of banned MTG cards see price spikes up to 300%
MORE FROM WARGAMER: All MTG sets in order, Upcoming MTG release dates,
title: Loads of banned MTG cards see price spikes up to 300%

description:
On Saturday, Games Workshop revealed a veritable armory of Warhammer 40k battleforces, bumper bundles of models that will go on sale for the winter holidays, with almost as many for its fantasy stabletmate Age of Sigmar. We've summarised what it would cost to buy the contents of each box from the GW webstore, to help you decide which ones offer the most bang for your buck.

Continue reading Here’s what all the Warhammer 40k and AoS Christmas bundles are worth
MORE FROM WARGAMER:
title: Here’s what all the Warhammer 40k and AoS Christmas bundles are worth
